conclusion: To determine the amount of heat exchanged by the gas during the cyclic process ABCDA, analyze each segment of the cycle and use the first law of thermodynamics: Q_net = W_net.
The work done by the gas during a cyclic process can be calculated as the area enclosed by the cycle on the p-V diagram.
Segment AB is an isobaric process with pressure P2 and volume change V2 - V1.

premise: Segment AB is an isobaric process with pressure P2 and volume change V2 - V1.
conclusion: Work done during AB: W_AB = P2 * (V2 - V1).
Segment BC is an isochoric process with volume V2 and pressure change P2 - P1.

premise: Segment BC is an isochoric process with volume V2 and pressure change P2 - P1.

conclusion: Segment CD is an isobaric process with pressure P1 and volume change V1 - V2.

premise: Segment CD is an isobaric process with pressure P1 and volume change V1 - V2.
conclusion: Work done during CD: W_CD = P1 * (V1 - V2).
Segment DA is an isochoric process with volume V1 and pressure change P1 - P2.

premise: Segment DA is an isochoric process with volume V1 and pressure change P1 - P2.

conclusion: Net work done: W_net = P2 * (V2 - V1) + P1 * (V1 - V2).
